qas.question: How was Espanyol viewed as being toward Spanish authority by the people of Barcelona?
What kind of spirit does Team Barcelona seem to encourage?
What type of supporters did Barcelona  attract?
From where did Espanyol draw their supporters?
When did Barcelona act as a draw to new arrivals from Catalan?

context: Traditionally, Espanyol was seen by the vast majority of Barcelona's citizens as a club which cultivated a kind of <a0_0>compliance<a0_0/> to the central authority, in stark contrast to Barça's <a1_0>revolutionary<a1_0/> spirit. Also in the <a4_0>1960s and 1970s<a4_0/>, while FC Barcelona acted as an integrating force for <a2_0>Catalonia's new arrivals<a2_0/> from poorer regions of Spain expecting to find a better life, Espanyol drew their support mainly from sectors <a3_0>close to the regime<a3_0/> such as policemen, military officers, civil servants and career fascists.
